SENT.plain: Capgras' syndrome is characterized by a subjective certainty that a familiar person has been replaced by an identical double
This syndrome has been observed in psychiatric and neurological diseases, and has been reported in several cases of dementia of the Alzheimer type
Here, we present a patient with vascular dementia in whom Capgras' syndrome developed in the early stages of dementia, and who exhibited violence
This case suggests that Capgras' syndrome can occur in vascular dementia
In older patients with this syndrome, dementia should also be considered in its differential diagnosis
In addition, patients with Capgras' syndrome should be evaluated for violent potential
